availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John S. Wilson (Fayette County, Kentucky, druggist)

body.p: Fayette County, Kentucky, druggist. Son of John Wilson and Rachel Dewees Wilson. Married to Mary Jane Rhoads Wilson. Father of Laura Wilson. Married to Lydia Ann Wickliffe in Nelson County on April 20, 1847. Father of Annie Logan Wilson, Rachel Dewees Wilson, Sallie Wickliffe Wilson, Nathaniel Wickliffe Wilson, Mary Preston Wilson. Apothecary in Lexington in 1850. Druggist in Lexington in 1860. Employed Margaret Conklin as a nurse in Lexington in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fayette County, District 2, p. 199B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fayette County, Lexington, p. 570.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fayette County, Lexington Ward 3, p. 258A.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Nelson County Marriages, Film #000481508, p. 541.
The Dewees Family : Genealogical data, biographical facts and historical information, Mrs. Philip E. LaMunyan, Ellwood Roberts, ed. Norristown, PA: William H. Roberts, 1905, 44 & 55.
